metadata.description:
The data set includes observation data of meteorological elements in the downstream desert station of Heihe Hydrometeorological Observation Network from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2017. The site is located in the desert beach of Ejin Banner, Inner Mongolia, and the underlying surface is red sand desert. The latitude and longitude of the observation point is 100.9872E, 42.1135N, and the altitude is 1054m.The air temperature and relative humidity sensors are installed at 5m and 10m, facing the north; the barometer is installed at 2m; the tipping bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m; the wind speed sensor is set at 5m, 10m, and the wind direction sensor is set at 10m, facing the north; the four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing south; two infrared thermometers are installed at 6m, facing south, the probe orientation is vertically downward; the soil temperature probe is buried in the ground surface 0cm and underground 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm 40cm, 60cm and 100cm, in the south of the 2m from the meteorological tower; soil moisture sensors are buried in the underground 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm and 100cm, in the south of the 2m from the meteorological tower; soil heat flux plates (3 pieces) are buried in the ground 6 cm in order.
Observation items include: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m, RH_5m, Ta_10m, RH_10m) (unit: centigrade, percentage), air pressure (Press) (unit: hectopascal), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_5m, WS_10m) (unit: m / s), wind direction (WD_10m) (unit: degree), four-component radiation (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts / square meter), surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2 ) (unit: centigrade), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watts/square meter), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_60cm, Ms_100cm) (unit: volumetric water content, percentage) and soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_60cm, Ts_100cm) (unit: centigrade).
Processing and quality control of the observation data: (1) ensure 144 data per day (every 10 minutes), when there is missing data, it is marked by -6999; From September 17, 2017 to September 23,  due to the re-enhancement of the observation tower, the data is missing (the four-component radiation missing period is from September 9 to September 23); (2) eliminate the moment with duplicate records; (3) delete the data that is obviously beyond the physical meaning or the range of the instrument; (5) the format of date and time is uniform, and the date and time are in the same column. For example, the time is: 2016-6-10 10:30; (6) the naming rules are: AWS+ site name.
For hydrometeorological network or site information, please refer to Li et al. (2013). For observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).

该数据集包含了2017年1月1日至2017年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网下游荒漠站气象要素观测数据，站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗荒漠滩，下垫面是红砂荒漠。观测点的经纬度是100.9872E, 42.1135N，海拔1054m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在2m处；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速传感器架设在5m、10m，风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m、Ta_10m、RH_10m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_5m、WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)和土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm）（单位：摄氏度）。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；2017.9.17-9.23由于重新加固观测塔，数据缺失（四分量辐射缺失时间段为9.9-9.23）；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2017-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况下。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层组件温度被用来估算蒸散发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观测比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估算蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度相关（EC）测量更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还因为EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及4.5米高处使用10 Hz采样频率的涡度相关系统测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热成像图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）及其在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中的蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）的比率，该实验是河西水文遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估算的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估算也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，先前的研究发现，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），阿拉尔海流域（斯坦耶夫等，2004；克雷托等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（斯通，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测，同时也记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了共11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics of data processing and quality control procedures in hydrometeorological datasets?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 水文气象数据集的数据处理和质量控制程序的特点是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: data collection, processing, archiving, removal of duplicate records, deletion of data that exceeds physical or instrumental limits, marking of questionable data, standardizing date and time formats, consistent naming conventions
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 数据收集、处理、存档、去除重复记录、删除超过物理或仪器限制的数据、标记可疑数据、标准化日期和时间格式、一致的命名约定。

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many observation stations are included in the hydrometeorological observation network dataset for the Heihe River Basin?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 黑河流域的水文气象观测网络数据集包含多少个观测站？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many ground-based measurements are taken daily in the meteorological observation dataset for the desert station in the Heihe River Basin?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域的沙漠站点，气象观测数据集中每天进行多少次地面测量？

Definition.QuestionEn: What are the common challenges faced in collecting and processing data for oasis-desert ecosystem studies?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在收集和处理绿洲-沙漠生态系统研究数据时面临的常见挑战是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Common challenges in collecting and processing data for oasis-desert ecosystem studies include dealing with the ecological environment degradation, such as land desertification and dust storms, as well as the need for long-term monitoring to understand energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange. Data processing involves ensuring quality control, such as removing outliers and filling missing data, to accurately reflect the complex interactions in these ecosystems.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在收集和处理绿洲-沙漠生态系统研究的数据时，常见的挑战包括应对生态环境退化，如土地沙漠化和沙尘暴，以及需要进行长期监测以了解能量、水蒸气和碳交换。数据处理涉及确保质量控制，例如去除异常值和填补缺失数据，以准确反映这些生态系统中的复杂相互作用。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for evapotranspiration using the TSEB model compare to those used for energy and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert systems?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用TSEB模型进行蒸散发的数据收集方法与在绿洲-沙漠系统中进行能量和碳交换观测所使用的方法相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The TSEB model involves ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, using thermal infrared cameras and EC systems. In contrast, energy and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert systems employ long-term datasets from eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, and automatic weather stations for various hydrometeorological parameters.
Comparison.AnswerCn: TSEB模型涉及使用热红外相机和涡度协方差系统测量的地面土壤和冠层组件温度。相比之下，绿洲-沙漠系统中的能量和碳交换观测则采用来自涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站的长期数据集，以获取各种水文气象参数。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the challenges faced in estimating evapotranspiration in arid agricultural areas differ from those encountered in managing oasis–desert systems?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在干旱农业地区估算蒸散发所面临的挑战与管理绿洲-沙漠系统时遇到的挑战有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Challenges in estimating evapotranspiration include difficulties in measuring soil and canopy temperatures and dealing with advective conditions. In contrast, oasis–desert systems face broader ecological issues such as river drying, vegetation degradation, and desertification, requiring a balance between ecological and socioeconomic concerns.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 估算蒸散发的挑战包括测量土壤和冠层温度的困难以及处理平流条件。相比之下，绿洲-沙漠系统面临更广泛的生态问题，如河流干涸、植被退化和沙漠化，需要在生态和社会经济问题之间取得平衡。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How does the integration of stable isotopes and eddy covariance systems contribute to the understanding of oasis-desert interactions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 稳定同位素和涡度协方差系统的结合如何有助于理解绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The integration of stable isotopes and eddy covariance systems allows for a more detailed validation of evapotranspiration components—evaporation and transpiration—by providing observed ratios of these components. This approach enhances the understanding of oasis-desert interactions by offering insights into the exchange of energy, water vapor, and carbon, which are crucial for maintaining the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases in arid regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 稳定同位素与涡度协方差系统的结合，使得对蒸散发组成部分——蒸发和蒸腾的验证更加详细，通过提供这些组成部分的观测比率。这种方法通过提供能量、水蒸气和碳的交换洞察，增强了对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的理解，这对于维持干旱地区绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展至关重要。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What are the implications of the observed data patterns from the HRB region for long-term ecological and hydrological modeling in arid and semi-arid areas?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: HRB地区观察到的数据模式对干旱和半干旱地区的长期生态和水文建模有什么影响？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The observed data patterns from the HRB region, which include long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, as well as auxiliary hydrometeorological data, provide critical insights for ecological and hydrological modeling. These patterns underscore the importance of understanding energy and water vapor exchanges in maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems, which is essential for sustainable development and ecological security in arid and semi-arid areas.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 来自HRB地区的观测数据模式，包括长期的能量、水汽和碳通量，以及辅助的水文气象数据，为生态和水文模型提供了重要的见解。这些模式强调了理解能量和水汽交换在维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间平衡的重要性，这对于干旱和半干旱地区的可持续发展和生态安全至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in accurately measuring soil and canopy component temperatures in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，准确测量土壤和树冠成分温度的挑战因素包括哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenges in measuring soil and canopy component temperatures in arid regions arise from image classification errors that vary with vegetation abundance, errors in determining surface composite radiometric temperature, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance, and uncertainties in estimating incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，测量土壤和冠层组成部分温度的挑战源于图像分类错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化；表面复合辐射温度的确定存在误差；忽略了大气上行辐射和透射率；以及在估算通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率时的不确定性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it important to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems for sustainable development in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在干旱地区保持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡对可持续发展很重要？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Maintaining a balance between oasis and desert systems is crucial for achieving sustainable development because oases play a critical role in ecological stability, agricultural productivity, and socioeconomic development, especially in arid regions where they support the majority of the population.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续发展至关重要，因为绿洲在生态稳定性、农业生产力和社会经济发展中发挥着关键作用，尤其是在干旱地区，它们支持着大多数人口。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the limitations in applying one-source evapotranspiration estimation models to heterogeneous landscapes?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致在异质景观中应用单一源蒸散发估算模型的局限性是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: One-source evapotranspiration estimation models are limited in heterogeneous landscapes because these models cannot accurately estimate surface evapotranspiration due to the mixture of soil and vegetation with different temperatures and resistances to energy exchange, which is not accounted for in a single-source approach.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 单源蒸散发估算模型在异质景观中的应用受到限制，因为这些模型无法准确估计表面蒸散发，因为土壤和植被的混合具有不同的温度和能量交换阻力，而单源方法未能考虑这些因素。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What potential outcomes could arise from implementing advanced remote sensing technologies in the collection of hydrometeorological data in arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区实施先进的遥感技术收集水文气象数据可能会产生哪些潜在结果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing advanced remote sensing technologies could enhance the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimations, improve the separation of soil and vegetation components, and facilitate better validation of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges. This could lead to more reliable data for understanding ecological interactions in oasis–desert systems and contribute to sustainable development strategies.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 实施先进的遥感技术可以提高蒸散发估算的准确性，改善土壤和植被成分的分离，并促进能量、水蒸气和碳交换的更好验证。这将有助于更可靠的数据，以理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的生态相互作用，并为可持续发展战略做出贡献。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of integrating long-term observational datasets from oasis–desert systems into current hydrometeorological research frameworks?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将长期观测数据集从绿洲-沙漠系统整合到当前的水文气象研究框架中会产生什么后果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating long-term observational datasets can provide a comprehensive understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, helping to recognize oasis–desert interactions. This could support ecological stability and socioeconomic development, offering insights into sustainable oasis management and contributing to the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合长期观测数据集可以提供对能量、水汽和碳交换的全面理解，帮助识别绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用。这可以支持生态稳定和社会经济发展，为可持续绿洲管理提供见解，并有助于实现碳达峰和碳中和的目标。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the use of high-resolution thermal imaging impact the accuracy of evapotranspiration measurements in heterogeneous land surfaces?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 高分辨率热成像的使用如何影响异质土地表面蒸散发测量的准确性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using high-resolution thermal imaging can improve the accuracy of evapotranspiration measurements by providing precise soil and canopy component temperatures. This can lead to better separation of soil and vegetation latent fluxes, reducing uncertainties and enhancing the reliability of models like the TSEB in estimating E, T, and ET, even in strongly advective conditions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热成像可以通过提供精确的土壤和冠层组件温度来提高蒸散发测量的准确性。这可以更好地区分土壤和植被的潜热通量，减少不确定性，并增强像TSEB这样的模型在估计E、T和ET时的可靠性，即使在强烈的平流条件下也是如此。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the key objectives behind implementing a comprehensive meteorological and hydrological observation network in arid regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区实施综合气象和水文观测网络的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objectives include understanding the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems to achieve sustainable oasis development, carbon neutrality, and ecological security, especially in regions with significant ecological challenges such as the drying up of water bodies and land desertification.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标包括理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换，以实现可持续的绿洲发展、碳中和和生态安全，特别是在面临重大生态挑战的地区，如水体干涸和土地沙漠化。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What motivates the use of thermal infrared cameras and radiometric temperature measurements in studying soil and canopy component temperatures?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 使用热红外相机和辐射温度测量研究土壤和冠层组件温度的动机是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The motivation is to refine the TSEB model by accurately calculating soil and vegetation component temperatures, which is crucial for estimating energy fluxes like evaporation and transpiration, especially in areas with strong advective conditions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 动机是通过准确计算土壤和植被组分的温度来完善TSEB模型，这对于估算能量通量（如蒸发和蒸腾）至关重要，特别是在强烈的平流条件下。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the key procedures involved in setting up and maintaining an automated meteorological observation station in arid regions for hydrometeorological data collection?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区建立和维护自动气象观测站以收集水文气象数据的关键程序是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The setup of an automated meteorological observation station involves installing various sensors at specific heights and orientations to measure air temperature, relative humidity, wind speed, wind direction, atmospheric pressure, precipitation, radiation, and soil temperature and moisture. The data is collected every 10 minutes, and quality control is applied to ensure data integrity, including handling missing data, removing duplicates, and flagging questionable data.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 自动气象观测站的设置涉及在特定高度和方向安装各种传感器，以测量空气温度、相对湿度、风速、风向、大气压力、降水、辐射以及土壤温度和湿度。数据每10分钟收集一次，并进行质量控制以确保数据的完整性，包括处理缺失数据、删除重复数据和标记可疑数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can thermal infrared cameras be used to enhance the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates in heterogeneous land surfaces?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 热红外相机如何用于提高异质土地表面蒸散发估算的准确性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Thermal infrared cameras are used to capture high-resolution thermal images that help calculate soil and canopy component temperatures. These temperatures are classified using visible and NIR images to separate soil and canopy pixels, which are then used to improve the accuracy of the two-source energy balance model by providing precise inputs for estimating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 热红外相机用于捕捉高分辨率的热图像，帮助计算土壤和冠层组件的温度。这些温度通过可见光和近红外图像进行分类，以分离土壤和冠层像素，然后用于提高双源能量平衡模型的准确性，为估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散提供精确的输入。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the specific challenges and methods associated with long-term data collection for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，长期数据收集与能量、水蒸气和碳交换相关的具体挑战和方法是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Challenges include maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems and ensuring ecological stability. Long-term data collection involves using eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for turbulent flux data, automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data, and additional measurements of vegetation and soil parameters. Data processing includes collection, processing, and quality control to ensure reliable datasets.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 挑战包括维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡以及确保生态稳定。长期数据收集涉及使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取湍流通量数据，自动气象站获取水文气象数据，以及对植被和土壤参数的额外测量。数据处理包括数据的收集、处理和质量控制，以确保数据集的可靠性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements enable the accurate measurement and collection of soil and canopy temperatures in arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在干旱地区准确测量和收集土壤和树冠温度成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of a high-resolution thermal camera and the series TSEB model enables the accurate estimation of soil and canopy temperatures by measuring thermal radiation and applying data from satellite- and ground-based sources. This approach allows for precise component temperature calculations, which are crucial for estimating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪和TSEB模型，通过测量热辐射并应用来自卫星和地面来源的数据，可以准确估计土壤和冠层温度。这种方法允许精确计算各组成部分的温度，这对于估算异质景观中的蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发至关重要。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways do eddy covariance systems facilitate the monitoring of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in diverse ecological landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差系统如何促进在不同生态景观中监测能量、水蒸气和碳通量？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Eddy covariance systems provide half-hourly turbulent flux data that are critical for analyzing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis-desert areas. This method allows researchers to gather long-term datasets on fluxes, which are essential for evaluating ecological interactions and supporting sustainable development goals in arid and semiarid regions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统提供半小时的湍流通量数据，这对于分析绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要。这种方法使研究人员能够收集关于通量的长期数据集，这对于评估生态相互作用和支持干旱及半干旱地区的可持续发展目标是必不可少的。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the anticipated challenges when using composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions for estimating energy exchange?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区使用复合温度分离方法估算能量交换时，预期会面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: In arid regions, composite temperature separation approaches may be limited in effectiveness because of difficulties in measuring evaporation and transpiration on the ground. Errors in image classification can lead to inaccuracies, such as soil pixels being counted as vegetation pixels, which affects temperature estimates and, consequently, the accuracy of energy exchange estimations.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，复合温度分离方法的有效性可能受到限制，因为在地面上测量蒸发和蒸腾存在困难。图像分类中的错误可能导致不准确，例如土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这会影响温度估计，从而影响能量交换估计的准确性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it critical to achieve a balance between oasis and desert systems in the context of sustainable development and ecological security?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在可持续发展和生态安全的背景下，为什么在绿洲和沙漠系统之间实现平衡至关重要？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Achieving a balance between oasis and desert systems is crucial for sustainable development to support ecological security and socioeconomic development. Oases play a significant role in maintaining stable ecological environments and agricultural productivity, which are essential for the ecological stability and sustainability of the regions they support.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在可持续发展中，实现绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于支持生态安全和社会经济发展至关重要。绿洲在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着重要作用，这对它们所支持地区的生态稳定性和可持续性至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, how might the integration of ground-based and satellite data improve the accuracy and applicability of models like the TSEB in estimating evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在您看来，地面数据和卫星数据的整合如何能够提高像TSEB这样的模型在估算异质景观中的蒸散量时的准确性和适用性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The integration of ground-based and satellite data could significantly enhance the accuracy and applicability of models like the TSEB. Ground-based measurements provide detailed, localized data, while satellite data offers broader spatial coverage. This combination could help address the limitations of current models, such as the challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes and component temperatures, ultimately leading to more reliable evapotranspiration estimates in heterogeneous landscapes.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 地面数据和卫星数据的结合可以显著提高像TSEB这样的模型的准确性和适用性。地面测量提供了详细的局部数据，而卫星数据则提供了更广泛的空间覆盖。这种结合可以帮助解决当前模型的局限性，例如在准确估计表面通量和组分温度方面的挑战，最终在异质景观中提供更可靠的蒸散发估计。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the data collection techniques used to partition evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration components efficiently.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对用于有效地将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾成分的数据收集技术感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data collection techniques for partitioning evapotranspiration (ET) often involve using ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures combined with advanced models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model. The TSEB model separates the energy balance into soil and canopy components using thermal infrared imagery and high-resolution thermal cameras, which helps improve the accuracy of estimating evaporation and transpiration ratios.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 用于分区蒸散发（ET）的数据收集技术通常涉及使用地面测量的土壤和冠层组件温度，结合先进的模型，如双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型。TSEB模型通过热红外影像和高分辨率热像仪将能量平衡分为土壤和冠层组件，这有助于提高蒸发和蒸腾比估算的准确性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how the data processing and quality control procedures are implemented for datasets collected over arid regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解在干旱地区收集的数据集是如何实施数据处理和质量控制程序的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data processing and quality control procedures in arid regions involve several steps, such as ensuring accurate data collection through instruments like automatic weather stations and eddy covariance systems. The data is processed to remove any errors or inconsistencies, such as duplicate records or data points that exceed physical or instrumental limits. Missing data is marked, and data is standardized for consistency, which helps in maintaining reliable datasets for analysis.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，数据处理和质量控制程序涉及多个步骤，例如通过自动气象站和涡度协方差系统确保准确的数据收集。数据经过处理，以去除任何错误或不一致之处，例如重复记录或超过物理或仪器限制的数据点。缺失的数据被标记，并且数据被标准化以保持一致性，这有助于维护可靠的数据集以供分析。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline strategies for overcoming the challenges associated with accurate measurement and data quality control in hydrometeorological studies, particularly in oasis-desert ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 概述克服与水文气象研究中准确测量和数据质量控制相关的挑战的策略，特别是在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Strategies to overcome challenges in data quality control include implementing robust data validation protocols such as identifying and marking missing data, removing duplicate records, and discarding data that fall outside physical or instrumental limits. Additionally, establishing standardized formats for date and time, and employing techniques to separate soil and vegetation component temperatures using thermal imagery can enhance measurement accuracy. Continuous monitoring and equipment calibration are essential to mitigate the effects of environmental factors on sensor performance.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 克服数据质量控制挑战的策略包括实施强有力的数据验证协议，例如识别和标记缺失数据、删除重复记录以及丢弃超出物理或仪器限制的数据。此外，建立标准化的日期和时间格式，以及采用技术分离土壤和植被成分温度的热成像，可以提高测量的准确性。持续监测和设备校准对于减轻环境因素对传感器性能的影响至关重要。
